Over-the-counter medications: Although medicines have disappeared, over-the-counter medications like pain relievers, decongestants, and antihistamines may still be available. These can help alleviate symptoms such as fever, congestion, and sneezing.
Natural remedies: Some natural remedies like honey, lemon, and ginger can help soothe a sore throat and reduce inflammation. Drinking hot liquids like tea or soup can also help ease congestion.
Steam inhalation: Inhaling steam from a bowl of hot water can help relieve congestion and make it easier to breathe. Adding eucalyptus oil to the water can enhance its benefits.
Humidifiers: Using a humidifier can help increase the moisture in the air, which can alleviate congestion and make it easier to breathe.
Saline nasal sprays: While not a substitute for medication, saline nasal sprays can help loosen mucus and make it easier to blow your nose.
